publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2914 Eleanor Scott: Assynt Foundation—That the Parliament congratulates the Assynt Foundation on its success in raising the £2.9 million needed to exercise its right to buy the Glencanisp and Drumrunie estates and Glencanisp Lodge; commends all those individuals, government agencies and other organisations who have contributed funds; welcomes the transfer of the beautiful and iconic Assynt mountains to community ownership; recognises the historic significance of returning land that was emptied of people during the Highland Clearances back to local management, and wishes the people of Assynt well in achieving their ambitions to develop the land sustainably for the benefit of current and future generations. Supported by: Fergus Ewing*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Richard Lochhead*, Rob Gibson*, Patrick Harvie*, Shiona Baird*, Chris Ballance*, Jim Mather*, Christine Grahame*, Ms Sandra White*, Scott Barrie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-2914 Assynt Foundation (lodged on 3 June 2005) Mark Ballard*, Robin Harper*
S2M-2914 Assynt Foundation (lodged on 3 June 2005) Maureen Macmillan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2914 Assynt Foundation (lodged on 3 June 2005) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-2914 Assynt Foundation (lodged on 3 June 2005) John Swinburne*
S2M-2914 Assynt Foundation (lodged on 3 June 2005) Frances Curran*
S2M-2914 Assynt Foundation (lodged on 3 June 2005) Linda Fabiani*
